Here we have curated a list containing some of the most famous hill stations close to the capital of India. Here is the list of 35 Best Hill Stations Near Delhi 1. Mussoorie, Uttarakhand 4.8 /5 View 31+ photos Known For : Mussoorie Mall Road Lal Tibba Kempty Falls Mussoorie is one of the nearest and most popular hill stations from Delhi, situated at an altitude of 6000 ft. It is famous for its colonial heritage and religious sites. Take a walk to the Mall road, drive to Dhanualti, visit the Kempty falls, visit Landour Ruskin Bond's residence town or just lay back in your hotel.Time Required: It takes around 6-7 hours to reach Mussoorie from Delhi. Distance from Delhi: 272 km Best Time: September to June 36 Mussoorie Attractions View Packages Read More 2. Nainital, Uttarakhand 4.4 /5 View 36+ photos Known For : Naini Lake Snow View Point Mall Road Nainital Nainital with its beautiful lakes, temples and exotic scenery offers a tranquil and scenic ambience around and is the perfect weekend getaway nestled in the arms of Kumaon Hills. Nainital is set in a valley containing a pear-shaped lake that offers a number of temples and trekking places. Naukuchiatal and Bhimtal are beautiful places nearby.Time Required: It takes around 8 hours to reach Nainital from Delhi. Distance from Delhi: 288 km Best Time: Throughout the year 33 Nainital Attractions View Packages Read More 3. Lansdowne, Uttarakhand 4.6 /5 View 17+ photos Known For : Bhulla Lake Tip N Top Tarkeshwar Mahadev Temple Originally popular with the British, Lansdowne at an altitude of 1,706 mt on a hillock is famous for its pristine Himalayan beauty, oak and pine forests, snow-covered peaks and lovely fresh air. Devoid of the usual hustles and bustle of hill stations, here one can go around churches, temples, cafes and other sightseeing spots.Time Required: It takes around 7 hours to reach Landsdowne from Delhi. Distance from Delhi: 242 km Best Time: Throughout the year 14 Lansdowne Attractions View Packages Read More 4. Manali, Himachal Pradesh 4.8 /5 View 11+ photos Known For : Solang Valley Hadimba Devi Temple Manali Mall Road One of the most popular hill stations near Delhi and in India, Manali offers the most magnificent views of the Pir Panjal and the Dhauladhar ranges covered with snow for most parts of the year. It is an adventure freak's heaven and has sports like trekking, paragliding, skiing, rock climbing, river rafting, zorbing, snow scootering and river crossing.Time Required: It takes around 10-12 hours to reach Manali from New Delhi Distance from Delhi: 537 km Best Time: October to June 53 Manali Attractions View Packages Read More Delhi Travel Packages Compare quotes from upto 3 travel agents for free 3 Nights / 4 Days Short Break to Delhi and Agra Delhi(2N) → Agra(1N) ₹12,100/person Get Offers> 5 Nights / 6 Days Splendid Delhi Agra Jaipur Package Delhi(2N) → Agra(1N) → Jaipur(2N) ₹ 25,000 20% off ₹19,840/person Get Offers> 3 Nights / 4 Days Dharamshala Dalhousie Honeymoon Package Dharamshala(1N) → Dalhousie(1N) ₹14,500/person Get Offers> 6 Nights / 7 Days Romantic Kullu Manali Shimla Volvo Tour Package Delhi(1N) → Manali(3N) → Shimla(2N) ₹ 21,999 29% off ₹15,500/person Get Offers> 4 Nights / 5 Days Spirited Kasol and Manali Trip Kasol(1N) → Kheerganga(1N) → Manikaran(1N) → Manali(1N) ₹ 21,800 20% off ₹17,400/person Get Offers> 6 Nights / 7 Days Royal Heritage Tour to Delhi, Agra, Jaipur and Nainital Delhi(1N) → Haridwar(1N) → Nainital(2N) → Agra(1N) → ... ₹21,999/person Get Offers> View All Packages For Delhi View All Packages For Delhi 5. Dalhousie, Himachal Pradesh 4.6 /5 View 11+ photos Known For : Panchpula Dainkund Peak Beeji's Park Dalhousie is a cool hill retreat with a serene atmosphere and prominent traces of India's British association such as colonial mansions. Long walks and treks are a favourite pass time here. Khajjiar is a stunning valley nearby.Time Required: It takes around 12 hours to reach Dalhousie from Delhi Distance from Delhi: 568 km Best Time: Throughout the year 29 Dalhousie Attractions View Packages Read More 6. Mcleodganj, Himachal Pradesh 4.2 /5 View 19+ photos Known For : Naddi View Point St. John in the Wilderness Church Dalai Lama Temple Mcleodganj is a hill station near Delhi, popular among trekkers. It is also known as Little Lhasa and is famous around the world for being home to the Tibetan spiritual leader Dalai Lama. Mcleodganj has one of the most mesmerising landscapes in the entire state of Himachal Pradesh.Time Required: It takes around 8-10 hours to reach Mcleodganj from Delhi Distance from Delhi: 485 km Best Time: October to June 42 Mcleodganj Attractions View Packages Read More 7. Shimla, Himachal Pradesh 4.8 /5 View 24+ photos Known For : Jakhu Temple Mall Road, Shimla Rashtrapati Niwas (Viceregal Lodge) Shimla is the capital of Himachal Pradesh in India and a popular hill station near Delhi, especially among Indian families and honeymooners. It still retains its old-world charm with beautiful colonial architecture, pedestrian-friendly Mall Road and the ridge lined up with multiple shops, cafes and restaurants. The weather is pleasant for most of the months.Time Required: It takes around 8 hours to reach Shimla from Delhi Distance from Delhi: 349 km Best Time: October to June 65 Shimla Attractions View Packages Read More 8. Jibhi, Tirthan Valley Often referred to as a mesmerising hamlet situated amidst the lush green forests and surrounded by variegated mountains, Jibhi is an offbeat place in Himachal Pradesh. The dense pine forests, tranquil freshwater lakes and pristine temples make this place worth visiting. The cosy Victorian-style cottages to stay in are a bonus.Time Required: It takes around 12 hours to reach Jibhi from Delhi Read More 9. Auli, Uttarakhand 4.3 /5 View 12+ photos Known For : Auli Ropeway Skiing in Auli Joshimath Dotted with apple orchards, oaks and deodars; Auli is a popular hill resort near Delhi, dating back to the 8th Century AD. Auli is the place for ski-lovers. The world's highest man-made lake is situated at Auli. Apart from skiing you can also go for numerous treks in the hills of Garhwal Himalayas and enjoy the spellbinding views of the snow-draped mountains.Time Required: It takes around 12 hours to reach Auli from Delhi by road Distance from Delhi: 495 km Best Time: December - February 12 Auli Attractions View Packages Read More 10. Kasol, Himachal Pradesh 4.5 /5 View 14+ photos Known For : Manikaran Sahib Nature Park Kasol Tosh One of the most popular hill stations near Delhi, especially among youths, Kasol is a must go place if you are looking for some serene surroundings. A small village in Himachal situated along the banks of the river Parvati, Kasol is a tourist attraction that is rapidly gaining fame as a very popular hub for trekkers, backpackers, and nature lovers. Commonly known as the Amsterdam of India, this quaint little village is resplendent in natural scenic beauty. Time Required: It takes around 12 hours to reach Kasol from Delhi Distance from Delhi: 518 km Best Time: October to June 30 Kasol Attractions View Packages Read More 11. Chail, Himachal Pradesh 4.3 /5 View 10+ photos Known For : Chail wildlife sanctuary Camping Kali Temple, Chail Chail is a quiet hill station near Delhi, known for the world's highest cricket ground and the heritage hotel, Chail Palace, in the midst of pine and deodar trees. Tourists typically cover Shimla, Kufri and Chail in the same trip and many Shimla packages also offer the same. Chail also offers various trekking and camping options for adventure enthusiasts.Time Required: It takes around 7-8 hours to reach Chail from Delhi Distance from Delhi: 346 km Best Time: Throughout the year 11 Chail Attractions View Packages Read More 12. Kausani, Uttarakhand 4.6 /5 View 14+ photos Known For : Rudradhari Falls and Caves Gwaldam Trek to Pinnath Embellished with all the right ingredients including a lush green valley, verdant pine tree forests, meandering creeks, tranquillity and majestic Himalayan peaks, Kausani is one of the most spellbinding hill stations near Delhi. It is ideal for honeymooners, nature lovers and travellers.Time Required: It takes around 6 hours to reach Kasauni from Delhi Distance from Delhi: 403 km Best Time: April to June, September to December 11 Kausani Attractions View Packages Read More 13. Dharamsala, Himachal Pradesh 4.3 /5 View 31+ photos Known For : Dalai Lama Temple St. John in the Wilderness Church Dharamshala Cricket Stadium Dharamsala a serene getaway is an ideal backpacker paradise with a rich Tibetan influence and the holy residence of the Dalai Lama. Shop local handicrafts, sip in a cup of coffee or eat some local delicacies for an experience you will cherish long. McLoedGanj and Dharamkot are famous places nearby.Time Required: It takes around 8 hours to reach Dharamshala from Delhi Distance from Delhi: 475 km Best Time: October to June 40 Dharamsala Attractions View Packages Read More 14. Bir, Himachal Pradesh 4.7 /5 View 11+ photos Known For : Paragliding in Bir Billing Chokling Monastery Gunehar Waterfall Bir is a small town located in the state of Himachal Pradesh. It is one of the popular hill stations near Delhi and is known for adventures sports such as paragliding, treks and also as the town for meditation. Growing popular as a weekend getaway among youths, Bir has now many trendy hostels as well for budget accommodation.Time Required: It takes around 11 hours to reach Bir from Delhi Distance from Delhi: 519 km Best Time: March - May; September - November 29 Bir Attractions View Packages Read More 15. Parwanoo, Himachal Pradesh 4.2 /5 View 6+ photos Known For : Timber Trail Cable car Ride Fruit orchards This is a place where one can enjoy the captivating ambience of a hill station and the hustle-bustle of a city. Situated on the border of Haryana and Himachal Pradesh, this small town offers beautiful apple orchards and delicious fruit products. It is also popular for outdoor activities such as trekking and hiking.Time Required: It takes around 5-6hours to reach Parwanoo from Delhi. Distance from Delhi: 267 km Best Time: March to May, October to November 10 Parwanoo Attractions Read More 16. Kasauli, Himachal Pradesh 4.2 /5 View 22+ photos Known For : Monkey Point Toy Train Ride Timber Trail One of the closest hill stations near Delhi, located in the Solan district, Kasauli is famous for its pristine beauty and picturesque location. It's reminiscent of the Victorian Age and British rule in India. People seeking peace from the chaotic lifestyle must definitely come here. March to November is the best time to visit. Monkey Point, Baptist Church, Shri Baba Balak Nath Temple are a few of the famous attractions in Kasauli.Time Required: It takes around 6 hours to reach Kasauli from Delhi Distance from Delhi: 295 km Best Time: March - June; September - November 13 Kasauli Attractions View Packages Read More 17. Kufri, Himachal Pradesh 4.0 /5 View 10+ photos Known For : Himalayan Nature Park (Kufri Zoo) Skiing in Kufri Mahasu Peak Kufri, located at a distance of 16km from Shimla, is a popular tourist destination known for snow-laden peaks, skiing and Kufri Zoo. The main tourist part of Kufri is located on Mahasu peak at a height of 2,720 metres above sea level and travellers have to either hike or take a pony from the parking lot to reach Kufri.Time Required: It takes around 7-8 hours to reach Kufri from Delhi Distance from Delhi: 363 km Best Time: November to March 12 Kufri Attractions View Packages Read More 18. Dehradun, Uttarakhand 4.3 /5 View 34+ photos Known For : Robber's Cave Mindrolling Monastery Tapkeshwar Temple Nestled amidst the Doon Valley, Dehradun city is a very popular hill station near Delhi. It proudly boasts of a scenic backdrop of the Garhwal Himalayas. Regardless of whether you want to explore family-friendly tourist spots, try thrilling adventure activities with your friends, or watch a mesmerizing sunset with your partner amidst the mountains, Dehradun is the answer.Time Required: It takes around 6 hours to reach Dehradun from Delhi Distance from Delhi: 260 km Best Time: Throughout the year 38 Dehradun Attractions View Packages Read More 19. Bhimtal, Uttarakhand 4.2 /5 View 10+ photos Known For : Bhimtal Lake Aquarium Island Cafe Hanuman Garhi Perched at a height of 1370masl, Bhimtal is an idyllic and less-crowded version of Nainital, 23 km away. Bhimtal is a scenic hill station near Delhi, the charm of which lies in its off-beat, tranquil atmosphere. The picturesque Bhimtal Lake is a popular attraction for paddle boating, birding and nature walk. Time Required: It takes around 7 hours to reach Bhimtal from Delhi Distance from Delhi: 297 km Best Time: March to June, September to December 11 Bhimtal Attractions View Packages Read More 20. Mashobra, Himachal Pradesh 4.7 /5 View 6+ photos Known For : Reserve Forest Sanctuary Carignano Nature Park WildFlower Hall Hotel Mashobra is a lush green expanse in Himachal Pradesh, tucked away at a height of about 7700 feet, and is one of the hill stations near Delhi. Mashobra's proximity to Shimla makes it a perfect alternative for people who are looking for a peaceful little hill station.Time Required: It takes around 8 hours to reach Mashobra from Delhi Distance from Delhi: 359 km Best Time: April to June 11 Mashobra Attractions View Packages Read More 21. Dhanaulti, Uttarakhand 4.8 /5 View 12+ photos Known For : Dhanaulti Adventure Park Eco Park, Dhanaulti Apple Orchard Resort With minimal human intrusion, without overloading or overwhelming your senses or expectations, Dhanaulti slowly seeps into your conscience like a long lost pleasant dream, bringing with it comfort and quiet, and giving you the much-needed break from your humdrum routine life. Dhanulti is a place that you would like to go if you are looking for a simple hill station that is not as touristy as other hill stations in this area.Time Required: It takes around 6-7 hours to reach Dhanulti from Delhi Distance from Delhi: 300 km Best Time: September to June 10 Dhanaulti Attractions View Packages Read More 22. Palampur, Himachal Pradesh 4.2 /5 View 15+ photos Known For : Toy Train Saurabh Van Vihar Neugal Khad With pine and deodar forests and tea gardens encircling the town and numerous streams pouring in, Palampur is known for the enchanting combination of water and greenery. It is one of the unexplored destinations that offer a quaint and serene environment. Among the tourist attractions here, Tashi Jong Monastery, and the tea gardens should be on the must-visit listTime Required: It takes around 9-10 hours to reach Palampur from Delhi Distance from Delhi: 491 km Best Time: March -June; September - November 15 Palampur Attractions View Packages Read More 23. Malana, Kullu 4.3 /5 Malana, a small village is one of those hill stations near Delhi which is a blessing in disguise. If visiting Kasol, you need to get involved in a trekking expedition to Malana. Malana village is almost 21 km from Kasol. As you drive from Kasol to Malana, you will find an endpoint to the road. This endpoint is the spot from where the trek to Malana village begins. Trek 2 km uphill to reach the village of taboos. On your way, you will find the enchanting beauty river and valley.Time Required: It takes around 12-13 hours to reach Malana from Delhi Distance from Delhi: 526 km Read More 24. Narkanda, Himachal Pradesh 4.7 /5 View 14+ photos Known For : Skiing in Narkanda Hatu Peak Hatu Mata Temple Surrounded by forests and woodlands, Narkanda is a quaint little town in Shimla district that is popular for skiing in winters. Situated at a height of 9000 feet, this town attracts tourists for its ethereal natural beauty and its beautiful apple orchards.Time Required: It takes around 9 hours to reach Narkanda from Delhi Distance from Delhi: 409 km Best Time: Throughout the year 11 Narkanda Attractions View Packages Read More 25. Tosh, Kasol 4.2 /5 View 12+ photos Treacherous roads, hippie culture and some stunning sceneries - this is what makes up Tosh. This little village tucked in the Himachal offers ongoing trekkers pretty pastoral scenes and calming views. Gurdwara Manikaran Sahib, a mere 20-min drive from Kasol is popular for its hot springs.Time Required: It takes around 14 hours to reach Tosh from Delhi Distance from Delhi: 518 km Read More 26. Almora, Uttarakhand 4.3 /5 View 20+ photos Known For : Jageshwar Dunagiri Kasar Devi Temple Cradled in the wilderness of Himalayan ranges, the sprawling town of Almora shaped like a horseshoe, is a hill station that boasts of a pre-British heritage and an idyllic vibe. It is famous for its rich cultural heritage, unique handicrafts, sumptuous cuisine and magnificent wildlife, coupled with easy accessibility.Time Required: Almora is situated around 8-10 hours from Delhi by road. Distance from Delhi: 352 km Best Time: Throughout the year 16 Almora Attractions View Packages Read More 27. Ranikhet, Uttarakhand 4.3 /5 View 19+ photos Known For : Chaubatia Orchards Majhkhali Golf Course Ranikhet meaning Queen's meadow is a hill station near Delhi, developed by the Britishers around ancient temples, undulating Himalayan hills and forests. Ranikhet offers a panoramic view of the Himalayas, the beautiful orchard gardens and Tudor-style bungalows.Time Required: It takes around 8-9 hours to reach Kasauli from Delhi Distance from Delhi: 344 km Best Time: Throughout the year 22 Ranikhet Attractions View Packages Read More 28. Khajjiar, Himachal Pradesh 4.6 /5 View 15+ photos Known For : Khajjiar lake Homestay Experience in Khajjiar Kalatop Wildlife Sanctuary Often referred to as 'mini-Switzerland of India', Khajjiar is a small town near Dalhousie that provides tourists with a unique combination of forests, lakes and pastures. There is a small lake in the middle of the meadow with a stunning view. It is also popular for adventure sports including paragliding, zorbing, and horse-riding. Going to Khajjiar in the off-season can be exceptionally delightful.Time Required: It takes around 12-13 hours to reach Khajjiar from Delhi Distance from Delhi: 577 km Best Time: Throughout the year 14 Khajjiar Attractions View Packages Read More 29. Chamba, Himachal Pradesh 4.3 /5 View 8+ photos Known For : Chamera Lake Manimahesh Lake Church of Scotland Known for the ancient temples, the caves, and the edifices that speak highly of Indian history, Chamba is famous for mesmerising views of the Pir Panjal, Zanskar and Dhauladhar ranges in the backdrop of this picture-postcard town.  It is also the base camp for several treks in the great Himalayan ranges. Time Required: It takes around 12-13 hours to reach Chamba from Delhi Distance from Delhi: 585 km Best Time: October to June 18 Chamba Attractions View Packages Read More 30. Kangra, Himachal Pradesh 4.3 /5 View 11+ photos Known For : Kangra Fort Masrur Shaktipeeth Shri Brijeshwari Devi Temple Located in the middle of Majhi and Bener River, Kangra is one of the unique hill stations near Delhi which is renowned for rock-cut shrines and handicrafts which have historical and religious importance. Also called Nagarkot, the place was created by Katoch Kshatriya Rajputs of the Chandervanshi family.Time Required: It takes around 9 hours to reach Kasauli from Delhi Distance from Delhi: 458 km Best Time: September to June 22 Kangra Attractions Read More 31. Mukteshwar, Uttarakhand 4.7 /5 View 18+ photos Known For : Sitla Chauli ki Jaali Mukteshwar Dham Temple Mukteshwar is a small hill station mostly known for adventure sports such as rock climbing, rappelling etc. and the amazing view of Himalayan ranges. Mukteshwar is named after the 350-year-old Shiva Temple housed here called Mukteshwar Dham. The charm of this hilly town lies in spending tranquil time - enjoying nature and listening to the chirping of the birds.Time Required: Mukteshwar is situated around 8 hours from Delhi by road. Distance from Delhi: 333 km Best Time: October to June 12 Mukteshwar Attractions View Packages Read More 32. Binsar, Uttarakhand 4.4 /5 View 11+ photos Known For : Binsar Wildlife Sanctuary Bineshwar Temple Zero Point A small town set in the midst of lush green forests covered with oak, pine, deodar trees, Binsar has plenty of tourist attractions including green meadows, temples and the Binsar wildlife sanctuary.Time Required: It takes around 10 hours to reach Kasauli from Delhi Distance from Delhi: 382 km Best Time: Throughout the year 4 Binsar Attractions View Packages Read More 33. Nahan, Himachal Pradesh 4.3 /5 View 8+ photos Known For : Renuka Lake Suketi Fossil Park Trekking in Nahan Away from the buzzing crowd of the city, Nahan is a perfect romantic getaway, lying among the lofty Shivalik range, overlooking lush green fields. This little town today is dotted with gardens, temples and a manmade lake. Visit Nahan, a cantonment town of Himachal for an unforgettable experience.Time Required: It takes around 5 hours to reach Nahan from Delhi Distance from Delhi: 255 km Best Time: April to September 21 Nahan Attractions Read More 34. Munsiyari, Uttarakhand 4.1 /5 View 13+ photos Known For : Birthi falls Maheshwari Kund Panchachuli Peak A small village with an awe-inspiring panorama of the snow-capped Himalayan Range; Munsiyari is a hill station near Delhi located in the Pithoragarh District. Offering splendours of natural beauty in their most captivating form, this place is famous for its some highly adventurous and nerve-wracking trekking trails.Time Required: It takes around 16 hours to reach Munsiyarii from Delhi Distance from Delhi: 546 km Best Time: April to June, October to November 16 Munsiyari Attractions Read More 35. Uttarkashi, Uttarakhand 4.0 /5 View 13+ photos Known For : Dodital Lake Nachiketa Lake Dodital Dayara Pass Trek Endearingly called Devbhoomi, Uttarkashi, literally meaning 'Kashi of the North', is a quaint little town. Revered by the Hindus as one of their propitious religious sites, the townhouses are two of the total four holy shrines of Hindu mythology. There are also trekking and adventure activities available.Time Required: It takes around 10 hours to reach Uttarkashi from Delhi Distance from Delhi: 386 km Best Time: March to June, September to November 9 Uttarkashi Attractions View Packages Read More Which of these hill stations near Delhi have you visited?
